Instructions: Using the provided web search results, write a comprehensive reply to the given prompt. Make sure to cite results using [[number](URL)] notation after the reference. If the provided search results refer to multiple subjects with the same name, write separate answers for each subject.
Prompt: this is just a test

This Is Just a Test is a coming-of-age novel that explores themes of identity, family, and friendship. The book is written by two authors, Madelyn Rosenberg and Wendy Wan-Long Shang, who worked together to create a seamless tale of growing up and the challenges middle school brings.

The book follows the main character David Da-Wei Horowitz, who is half Jewish and half Chinese, as he undergoes a lot of conflict. His grandmothers bicker constantly over cultural differences and he is torn between maintaining a friendship with one of the most popular kids in school and standing up for his best friend.

According to a Goodreads review [[1](https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/30053510-this-is-just-a-test)], the book is described as a "wholesome, relatable, heartfelt read." Another Amazon review [[2](https://www.amazon.com/This-Just-Wendy-Wan-Long-Shang/dp/1338037722)] states that the book is "wonderfully written" and that David's struggle with his two friends is "authentic."
